pros: Collaborative Caring Involved Meaningful Fair pay
cons: None that I can think of at this time

pros: AZA has all of the qualities you would want to work for and they truly follow their values and help create a work life balance. Their teams are open to communication, collaboration, and compassion. They respect their employees and really value helping you with your career goals.
cons: There are not any cons.

job_title: Respite Care Provider in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Company provided awesome training for first time providers and sets you up to gain experience.
cons: Hours were capped just under full time regardless if assigned family required full time help. No benefits.

pros: Great environment and support with fair pay. Incredible job for college student.
cons: Can feel like being thrown into the lions den but if you are a people person you will do well.

job_title: Assistant Clinical Specialist in Peoria, AZ
pros: AZA United has been a breath of fresh-air. This company strives to be inclusive of not only their client's they serve, but of their employees as well. This company has been consistently provided excellent detail, demonstrated ethical ABA practices, and provide outstanding trainings/supports for their staff. This company truly cares about the community that they serve and it is not about "numbers" or unrealistic billable expectations. AZA United makes active choices to reduce burnout in staff regardless of what department you're in. I can confidently say this company is trusting, ethical, and one to stand behind with purpose.
cons: When getting "zoned" for clients, drive times and distance of location/placement can be unrealistic and exhausting commutes. Due to location of some clients, late nights 4/5 days of the week are typical.

review_title: Good place for career growth in BH field
pros: Wonderful teammates, good benefits, career growth for behavioral health clinicians
cons: Caseloads can be overwhelming, focus on increasing billable hours

review_title: An ideal place to work as a BCBA
job_title: BCBA Clinical Supervisor in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
* Billable expectation is lower than other ABA companies
* Flexible schedule (aside from sessions) and no weekends
* Ability to work a hybrid model (telehealth/in home)
* Great leadership and support from supervisors
* Work with a diverse client population (young toddlers to adults), working in multiple locations/homes
* CFC is a short term program, and we are able to be reinforced by the work we do/see behavior change in real time
cons: *Working until 7:30pm 4/5 nights of the week

review_title: A wonderful place to learn and grow!
job_title: Assistant Clinical Specialist in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Great, patient, and friendly staff who foster your growth. The work environment is judgement free and highly inclusive (even the company directors know you by name and are super approachable). The assistant clinical specialist role is especially unique in that it really prepares you to be a bcba instead of just getting thrown in the fire after you finish your hours. Oh and good pay is an added bonus.
cons: Sometimes tasks build up and you can get pretty busy but this is counterbalanced with some slow weeks

review_title: Supportive environment that values work/life balance
job_title: Registered Behavior Technician in Mesa, AZ
pros: AZA does a great job promoting work/life balance. There is continuing professional development for behavior technicians. I love that there is always something new to learn. There are great opportunities to grow and advance within the company. I am proud to work for an organization that continuously embodies its core values and provides the best services to clients and their families!
cons: No cons about the work culture, pay could be higher

review_title: Great place to work that gets it right
pros: Non-profit, focused on people and outcomes instead of the bottom line. If your gripe about ABA is that it's too money-driven, you're absolutely right and this is the place where that's not the case.
cons: There really haven't been any yet. It's demanding though, but in a good way.

pros: My position provides a flexible work schedule overall. AZA has a very supportive work environment and there are lots of learning opportunities. There is room for growth and supervisors are extremely helpful and knowledgeable.
cons: We work with families, so to accommodate their schedules and children’s school schedules expect to work late Monday-Thursday.

job_title: Clinical Supervisor BCBA in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Frequent contact with supervisors and supervisees, heavy emphasis on professional development, ethics-obsessed workplace, BCBA-owned, growing organization, but still has the small business feel
cons: late work hours to accommodate family schedules, cases can be intense and stressful

pros: Being able to work with and help out amazing families. Great support system at work. Always learning.
cons: Not in office. Working in homes and often late hours.

pros: I love how rewarding job is and ow supportive the team is.
cons: As an at home provider it can be a little lonly

pros: Truly compassionate and easy to contact when help is needed. On going training always given. Constant support from team.
cons: No toy allowance given although some BCBAs do give you some

pros: Management and BCBA’s offer a lot of support, rewarding working with clients, great families, positive work culture
cons: Pay isn’t very high, no benefits for part time employees, sometimes I don’t feel very supported

review_title: Gret job- especially for college students
job_title: Respite and Habilitation Provider in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Flexible, Fulfilling, Good pay, Good hours,
cons: Sometimes you get less hours than you hoped for.

pros: Positive work environment. Employers care about their employees and support employees wanting to grow within the company
cons: Schedule changes frequently but works well when you’re in school!

job_title: Senior Clinical Interventionist in Phoenix, AZ
pros:
Great clinical team
BCBA Supervision without a catch
cons:
Long hours
Lots of driving

pros: Making your own schedule , changing life
cons: No reimbursement for and low pay

job_title: ABA Therapist/Registered Behavioral Technician in Tempe, AZ
pros: Great people to work with.
cons: Commuting between families takes time and gas.

pros: So supportive, so many benefits, but best of all is how helpful and nice all our bosses are
cons: No cons that I can think of for this company

review_title: Client Families Make All the Difference
job_title: Respite and Habilitation Provider in Scottsdale, AZ
pros:
My client was AMAZING to work with. Their family was even better! They referred me in so the application process was seamless.

Once I started the training classes - all in person - I quickly progressed and gained great salary increases. I learned a lot and the other providers I worked with were fantastic in guiding me.

My schedule was flexible and I ended up working with my family for over 1.5 years!
cons: I overheard from others that the scheduling was difficult if you wanted multiple clients. There were also complaints about the limited ability to schedule in-person training.

job_title: Habilitation and Respite Provider in Phoenix, AZ
pros: Easily hired, great experience, rewarding
cons: need more training options, need more assistance from higher-ups

pros: It is rewarding seeing the child expand and learn new skills.
cons: The management team is not the best, and not transparent

review_title: AZA is the best agency ever!
pros: Continuous training, if you’re in a ECH case then you get on-going supervision by a ACS and BCBA
cons: Lower paying rates for demanding work, not enough hours to work here full time, yet you need to maintain 30 hours a week min to qualify for insurance, materials such as reinforcers come out of your own pocket. I’ve tried to address this before but I’ve just been told to go to a dollar store but that’s not even the case. It adds up for both parents and providers. For older employees we never get the benefit of paid trainings from when we first started, or $100 bonus start ups, and higher paying rates.

job_title: Respite Care Provider in Mesa, AZ
pros:
They really work hard to make sure that you have the training and help that you need to do your job.  They have so many resources to use and are very willing to give you feedback and help. They really care about their clients and emplyee's. 
You will get to have the pleasure of working with wonderful families and children. The smiles are never ending and it's fun to problem solve new and creative ways to overcome challenges.
cons:
You will need to be self motivated since when you are working with your clients it is just you and them.  You will not have the benefit of having co-workers. 
You will also need to make sure to be on top of your time sheets and both email and mail/walk them in on time.

pros: I’ve worked here for over 3 years and have loved all of it! My families have been amazing, the office staff has been incredibly helpful, and the clinical/assistant clinical supervisors have gone above and beyond to help whenever and however they can. This job helped get me into grad school to pursue my dream career and they offer training and one-on-one assistance that other companies don’t offer.
cons:
Lots of driving (which is a given, considering you are working in home) 

For kiddos who have aged out of the early childhood program, I wish there was a way to still have specific programs in place for them created by AZA with supervision and monthly meetings, just like the early childhood programs.

review_title: A non profit that goes above and beyond!
pros: AZA United is a locally grown company who has built a solid base in the metro area. They are about to explode into a much broader client area in the next year or so. They provide staff with comprehensive and continuing education available each month. There are few places you can receive this kind of skill support and at no cost to the employee. I have worked with them for many years and can't say enough good things about them. If you love kids and want to help these special kiddos this is by far the best company to work for. They will support and help you in every phase of your journey.
cons: As of now they only have one location, which isn't convenient for some of us to access on a regular basis.

pros: Flexible schedule, fun if you like working with kids,
cons: Lack of hours, a lot of driving. From the way the job was advertised to me, both online and in person, I thought I was going to be working at least 30 hours per week. On a good week I'll work about 15. I was promised that I would have multiple clients and they have yet to find me another (it's been 6 months and eve though I've filled out their paperwork to find a new client multiple times they haven't) So if you're looking for a job with decent hours this is probably not it.

pros: AZA United has friendly staff that are on a mission to help kids and families by providing quality services.  I have worked for non-profits for many years, and have sought out supervisors that though not perfect,  are working to make the lives of others better.  I believe this to be true here at AZA United.  I respect what AZA United is doing in the Autism Community and that is why I am here.
cons: Not really a Con to mention here.

pros: Everyone is truly committed to the mission - helping kids and families! And that focus comes from the very top. Good work/life balance, good benefits, set pay increases twice a year. Great people to work with.  Opening a new clinic which is exciting!
cons: Can be stressful at times, lots of compliance hoops to jump through, a lot of change (but that seems to come from outside factors)

review_title: Not a terrible job, but rough pay.
pros: You could set your own hours, were free to "interview" families for good fits, and I enjoyed the work -doing ABA therapy for kids with ASD.
cons: Tough to get to full time hours. Training and supervision was minimal, which can be tough when you are working with kids in the full range of diagnosis on the autism spectrum.  Pay was very low.

pros: A lot of support and supervision from professionals that have been in the field for many years. It's also a great organization to be if you are pursuing your BCBA.
cons:
Late nights
Lots of driving 
Wages are in the low end.

job_title: Habilitation and Respite Provider in Tempe, AZ
pros: I appreciate that they train and allow family members, such as grandparents to work with their grandchildren. They provide staff with comprehensive and continuing education, plus support as you need it.  I also appreciate the monthly training they offer and the basic required training.
cons: A couple of times the trainings have interfered with providing services to client.

review_title: Great organization to work for in the ABA field
pros:
Excellent work environment 
Paid holidays 
Flexible schedule 
Great leaders
cons:
Driving across the valley can be time-consuming 
Like any other non-profit organization, wages can be low for some positions.

pros: Caring environment, the people who work there are kind hearted and ready to help when needed.
cons: I can't see any really, other than not to burn yourself out

pros:
- flexible schedule
- good time management from management
cons: No cons you get to learn about aba from bcbas depending on the client

pros: The ability to work with incredible kids and families.  Flexible hours, plus excellent supervision.
cons: Not having the ability to interact as much with other co-workers.  If№

pros:
Flexible Schedules 
Families all over the valley
Trainings provided
Opportunities to advance
cons:
Hours are up to the provider
Do not always have direct supervision working 1 on 1 with a client

review_title: Love My Team! Love my Job!
pros: Opportunities for growth.  Supportive team based approach.  Individualized family centered supports.
cons: Work schedules vary significantly due to individual family needs.

job_title: Clinical Family Coach in Phoenix, AZ
pros: fulfilling work, regularly-scheduled raises, transparent leadership, collaborative team environment, plenty of opportunities to advance
cons: lots of driving, some late nights

pros: work/life balance, advancement opportunities, professional development, company values
cons: lower pay compared to competing companies
